item.title: Probe Heat Lights (EXCEPT CAPT AND F/O PITOT) – Heaters Operative

numlitem.para: Associated EICAS Advisory message is verified to be operative, and

placard.para: Placard appropriate Probe Heat Light (P5) "HEAT LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: PROBE HEAT LIGHTS: L/R AUX PITOT, L/R AOA, TAT

warning.para: DO NOT TOUCH PROBES DURING TEST. SEVERE BURNS MAY RESULT.

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PROBE HEATERS FOR MORE THAN 10 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE PROBE AND HEATER MAY RESULT.

numlitem.para: Verify probe heater functions as follows:
Apply electrical power to the aircraft.
At miscellaneous test panel (P-61), hold test switch in WINDOW/PROBE HEAT position.
Gain access to associated probe. Hold hand near probe and verify probe is warming up.
Verify associated EICAS advisory message operates normally as follows:
Apply electrical power to the aircraft.
Close all probe heat circuit breakers: L AUX (6L16), R AUX (6L21), L AOA (6L17), R AOA (6L23), TAT (L24).
Close all probe heat indication circuit breakers: L IND (11R17), R IND (11R26), L AOA (11R18), R AOA (11R27), TAT IND (11R25).
On P-61 test panel, hold the WING ANTI-ICE WINDOW/PROBE HEAT test switch in the WINDOW/PROBE HEAT position.
Verify no probe heat advisory messages are displayed on EICAS.
Open the associated probe heat circuit breaker mentioned in steps 2 and 3.
Hold the P-61 test switch in the WINDOW/PROBE HEAT position.
Verify associated PROBE HEAT EICAS advisory message annunciates (L/R AUX, L/R AOA, or TAT).
Restore aircraft to its normal configuration.
